intro: Leptilon canadense var. pusillum, commonly known as the small-flowered leptilon, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
